org.microbean.maven.cdi

Class MavenExtension

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.microbean.maven.cdi.MavenExtension
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Extension

    public class MavenExtension
extends Object
implements Extension
    A CDI 2.0 portable extension that exposes the Maven Artifact Resolver components as CDI beans, particularly for the purposes of dependency resolution.
    Author:
    Laird Nelson
    See Also:
    RepositorySystem, RepositorySystemSession

      Creates a new MavenExtension.

    • Method Detail

      • getGroupArtifactVersionCoordinates

        public Properties getGroupArtifactVersionCoordinates(URL location)
                                              throws IOException,
                                                     URISyntaxException
        Returns a Properties object containing the contents of a pom.properties file as commonly installed in .jar files by Maven.

        This method may return null.

        This method is not final due to CDI specification restrictions only.

        Parameters:
        location - the location of the classpath element (a .jar file, or, perhaps, a directory); may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        a Properties object, or null
        Throws:
        IOException - if an input/output error occurs
        URISyntaxException - if there was a problem constructing a URI

      • getBeanArchiveLocation

        public static final URL getBeanArchiveLocation(Bean<?> bean)
        Given a Bean, returns a URL representing the classpath root from which its bean class originates.

        This method may return null.

        Parameters:
        bean - the Bean whose classpath root should be returned; may be null in which case null will be returned
        Returns:
        a URL representing a classpath root from which the supplied Bean's bean class originates, or null
        See Also:
        getGroupArtifactVersionCoordinates(URL), Bean.getBeanClass(), Class.getProtectionDomain(), ProtectionDomain.getCodeSource(), CodeSource.getLocation()
